definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Marx was opposed to all claims of nationalism and chauvinism.
sentences.chinese: 馬克思反對一切民族主義和沙文主義的論調。

sentences.english: Of or relating to a chauvinistic patriot .
sentences.chinese: 沙文主義者的或與其有關的。

sentences.english: But Hassan doesn’t have a chauvinist bone in his body.
sentences.chinese: 但是哈桑的骨子裏並沒有沙文主義在體內。

sentences.english: I don’t want to sound too chauvinistic, but I’m very proud of that.
sentences.chinese: 我不想顯得過於沙文主義，但我確實感到非常自豪。

sentences.english: Jack is a real chauvinist pig.
sentences.chinese: 傑克是個徹頭徹尾的沙文主義者。

sentences.english: We resolutely oppose great power chauvinism.
sentences.chinese: 我們堅決反對大國沙文主義。

sentences.english: The man is no saint, and his movement displays a whiff of Hindu chauvinism (see article).
sentences.chinese: 人非聖賢，這次運動帶有印度沙文主義的色彩。

sentences.english: Chauvinism of science is incompatible between with the principle of democracy and liberty.
sentences.chinese: 科學沙文主義與民主和自由的基本原則是不相容的。

sentences.english: Their jingoism alienated supporters among Bangkok's middle classes.
sentences.chinese: 這種沙文主義使得黃衫軍與曼谷的中產階級日漸疏遠。

sentences.english: Judy: That was a time of savageness and chauvinism.
sentences.chinese: 那是個充斥着野蠻和沙文主義的年代。

sentences.english: The author lashed out against chauvinism.
sentences.chinese: 作者猛烈抨擊沙文主義。

sentences.english: It was a typical case of British chauvinism and insularity.
sentences.chinese: 這是典型的英國沙文主義和偏狹心理的事例。

sentences.english: It is also called male and female chauvinism.
sentences.chinese: 它也被稱作男性或者女性沙文主義。

sentences.english: Patriotism can turn into jingoism very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 愛國主義可以很快轉變爲沙文主義。

sentences.english: The Bond films glorify the sometimes chauvinistic persona of Bond.
sentences.chinese: 邦德電影有時讚頌了邦德性格中的沙文主義。

sentences.english: Not to be stuck with depending on chauvinist lamas.
sentences.chinese: 不被仰賴沙文主義的喇嘛所捆綁。

definition: bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to have no sense of shame/brazen
